hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

Nora has $\blueD{4}$ pots of flowers.


And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

Each pot has $\purpleC5$ daises in it.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{total number of daisies in all pots}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{total number of daisies in all pots}}$.

question.content:
Nora has $4$ pots of flowers. Each pot has $5$ daisies in it. 

**What does the expression $4\times5$ represent?**

choices.content: Total number of daisies in all pots
